channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 美国军队的未来如何？在其领导人中，有三大问题悬而未决： 👇
item.description: What is the future of America’s army? Among its leaders there are three big unsettled questions: econ.st/3I3V1tJ 👇

item.title:
♦️ 中国谴责美国否决联合国安理会关于加沙立即停火的决议。
♦️ 巴基斯坦两个最大的亲建制党派同意组建联合政府。
♦️ 英伟达从最近的人工智能热潮中获益。
关注今日新闻 👇
item.description:
♦️ China condemns America for vetoing a proposed UN Security Council resolution for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

♦️ Pakistan’s two biggest pro-establishment parties agree to form a coalition government.

♦️ Nvidia benefits from the recent AI boom.

Follow today’s news 👇

item.title: 收购派拉蒙之战标志着一个好莱坞王朝的衰落--同时也显示出娱乐业的现状令人遗憾👇。
item.description: The battle to buy Paramount marks the fading of a Hollywood dynasty—and shows the sorry state of the entertainment industry econ.st/3wo7nuc 👇

item.title: 我们正在招聘一名通讯员，负责对中国进行雄心勃勃、富有想象力和原创性的报道。截止日期为 2 月 23 日，详情请点击此处： 👇
item.description: We are hiring a correspondent to provide ambitious, imaginative and original coverage of China. The closing date is February 23rd and details are here: econ.st/47zBk7g 👇

item.title:
♦️ 尼基-黑莉誓言继续参加共和党总统初选。
♦️ 拜登政府表示，阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼死后将受到 "重大制裁"。
♦️ 美国国会驳回一起多元化案件。
关注美国政治最新动态 👉
item.description:
♦️ Nikki Haley vows to stay in the Republican presidential primary.

♦️ “Major sanctions” will follow Alexei Navalny’s death, says the Biden administration.

♦️ SCOTUS dismisses a diversity case.

Follow the latest in US politics 👉 econ.st/3I4SIXc

item.title: 一些中国民族主义者给唐纳德-特朗普起的绰号表明，这位前总统的过激行为使中国变得更加强大。习近平也这样看他吗？ 👇
item.description: The nickname some Chinese nationalists have given to Donald Trump suggests that the former president’s excesses make China stronger. Does Xi Jinping see him that way too? econ.st/3TfRnDz 👇

item.title: 对于日本的半导体工具制造商来说，中美关系的恶化为他们带来了商机。但在未来，这可能会成为一种压力👇。
item.description: For Japan’s semiconductor toolmakers the deteriorating relationship between America and China is a boon for business. In the future, though, it may become a strain econ.st/3UJxzJU 👇

item.title: 社会对我们狂轰滥炸，要求我们变得更快乐、更健康、更富有。为什么我们变得如此不满足于平凡？ 👇
item.description: Society bombards us with instructions to be happier, fitter and richer. Why have we become so dissatisfied with being ordinary? econ.st/3SNWklg 👇

item.title: 治疗 1 型糖尿病的新疗法正在出现。诀窍在于战胜免疫系统 👇
item.description: New treatments are emerging for type-1 diabetes. The trick is to outsmart the immune system econ.st/3SH0StM 👇

item.title: 乌克兰东部的城镇担心自己会成为俄罗斯的下一个目标。阿夫杰夫卡沦陷后，下一个目标会是哪？ 👇
item.description: Towns in eastern Ukraine fear they will be Russia’s next target. After the fall of Avdiivka, where will be next? econ.st/3T6CwuQ 👇

item.title: 对租房者而言，欧洲最昂贵的城市在哪里？我们的 Carrie Bradshaw 指数衡量了哪些地方的一居室公寓对普通收入者来说触手可及👇。
item.description: Where are Europe’s most expensive cities for renters? Our Carrie Bradshaw index measures where a one-bedroom flat is within reach for the average earner econ.st/3OPVCmo 👇

item.title:
长期以来，电气化一直被认为是绿化工业的一种方式。
现在，它突然受到了重新审视： 👇
item.description:
Electrification had long been written off as a way of greening industry.

Here’s why it is suddenly getting a second look: econ.st/4bIwKXy 👇

item.title:
"本-索贝尔（Ben Sobel）在一篇特约撰文中指出："不断加强的版权保护从公共领域扣留了难以估量的文化。
"但我们不会因为为人工智能巨头量身定制的例外情况而弥补这种损失"。
item.description:
“Ever-stronger copyright protection has withheld incalculable amounts of culture from the public domain,” argues Ben Sobel in a guest essay.

“But we won’t repair that damage with exceptions tailor-made to benefit the giants of AI” econ.st/42Nj2Pd

item.title:
阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼之死和阿夫季耶夫卡的沦陷，表明弗拉基米尔-普京铁了心要继续他的战争。
他的战争其实并不是为了乌克兰的领土，而是为了俄罗斯境内外的整个政治控制体系👇。
item.description:
The death of Alexei Navalny and the fall of Avdiivka are signs of Vladimir Putin’s iron determination to carry on his war.

His fight is not really about territory in Ukraine, but about an entire system of political control inside Russia and beyond it econ.st/3OQR5QD 👇

item.title: 土耳其是继美国和英国之后，剧本节目销量最大的国家。是什么让土耳其的节目如此值得狂欢？
item.description: After America and Britain, Turkey is the biggest seller of scripted shows. What makes its shows so binge­-worthy? econ.st/42IA7d3

item.title: 金斯伍德和威灵伯勒的选举结果虽然可怕，但对英国保守党来说却比想象的还要糟糕。工党最近在特别选举中的失利似乎是家常便饭。其实不然 👇
item.description: Terrible as they are, the results from Kingswood and Wellingborough are even worse for Britain’s Tories than they might seem. Labour has recently made upsets in special elections seem routine. They are not econ.st/3OKXuNb 👇

item.title: 我们正在招聘一名报道中国的记者。应聘者应愿意常驻中国大陆，并在 2 月 23 日前提出申请： 👇
item.description: We are hiring a correspondent to cover China. Candidates should be willing to be based in mainland China and should apply by February 23rd: econ.st/42LSldJ 👇

item.title: 中国的精英们担心，特朗普担任总统可能意味着一场更加激烈的贸易战，并可能带来巨大的经济损失。但他们也相信，特朗普对联盟的蔑视（看看他最近对北约的抨击）可能会给他们的国家带来巨大的利益👇。
item.description: China’s elite fear a Trump presidency could mean an even hotter trade war, with potentially vast economic costs. But they also believe his contempt for alliances (witness the latest outburst against NATO) could yield huge gains for their country econ.st/3I71vrH 👇

item.title:
大多数俄罗斯人从未要求战争，也不觊觎乌克兰领土，他们希望生活恢复正常。
日益增长的不满情绪并不意味着抗议运动正在形成，但民意调查显示，对战争的支持正在慢慢减弱
item.description:
Most Russians never asked for the war, did not crave Ukrainian territory, and want their lives to get back to normal.

Growing resentment doesn’t mean that a protest movement is building up, but polls suggest that support for the war is slowly eroding econ.st/48pFHlU

item.title: 欧洲人能在哪里负担得起独居生活？我们的卡莉-布莱德肖指数移居大洋彼岸 👇
item.description: Where can Europeans afford to live solo? Our Carrie Bradshaw index moves across the pond econ.st/3I7UqHp 👇

item.title: 我们最新的订户通讯《美国简讯》将为您提供由我们的记者和编辑精选的当日政治新闻的快速分析。注册接收每日版本 ⬇️
item.description: Our latest subscriber newsletter, The US in brief, will keep you up to date with fast analysis of the political stories of the day, chosen by our correspondents and editors. Sign up to receive daily editions econ.st/3OPIZYw ⬇️

item.title: 无论阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的死亡证明上写的是什么，他都是被弗拉基米尔-普京杀害的。他的谋杀不是第一次，也不会是最后一次。
item.description: Whatever ends up on Alexei Navalny’s death certificate, he was killed by Vladimir Putin. His murder was not the first and it will not be the last econ.st/49eUcKo 👇

item.title: 派拉蒙公司（Paramount）曾出品过不少浪漫爱情片。现在，这家好莱坞制片厂本身也成为了一出求爱大戏的主角，其中涉及流媒体竞争对手、私人股本大亨、亿万富翁的儿子以及气象频道的所有者👇。
item.description: Paramount has produced plenty of good romances in its time. Now the Hollywood studio is itself the subject of a courtship drama involving streaming rivals, private-equity buccaneers, a billionaire’s son and the owner of the Weather Channel econ.st/3UJthSx 👇

item.title: 人工智能的复兴能否帮助美国的科技之都扭转局面？@arynbraun 和 @econcallum 加入本周的 "Money Talks "播客，共同探讨旧金山的未来 🎧。
item.description: Could the AI renaissance help America’s tech capital turn things around? @arynbraun and @econcallum join this week’s “Money Talks” podcast to consider San Francisco’s future econ.st/3uLOjFv 🎧

item.title: 二十年的阿富汗和伊拉克战争耗尽了美国的军队、装备和思想。征兵短缺的问题仍未解决。现在，中国的崛起和乌克兰战争的教训促使美国进行反思、更新和改革👇。
item.description: Two decades of war in Afghanistan and Iraq wore out America’s troops, equipment and ideas. A recruitment shortage remains unresolved. Now the rise of China and the lessons from the war in Ukraine have prompted introspection, renewal and reform econ.st/3SJEtMj 👇

item.title: 杰米-德里斯科尔能否效仿肯-利文斯通？认识向英国工党发起挑战的（另一位）左翼人士 👇
item.description: Can Jamie Driscoll emulate Ken Livingstone? Meet the (other) left-wing challenge to Britain’s Labour Party econ.st/49Gst59 👇

item.title: 去年，美国钢铁公司表示已同意被日本最大的钢铁制造商新日铁公司收购。随之而来的一桩桩事件成为美国保护主义蠕变的案例研究 👇👇。
item.description: Last year US Steel said it had agreed to be bought by Nippon Steel, Japan’s biggest steelmaker. The ensuing pile-on has been a case study in America’s protectionist creep econ.st/4bDbToC 👇

item.title: 俄罗斯间谍正在化险为夷。比如瓦格纳集团：克里姆林宫的特务机构很快就把叶夫根尼-普里戈金（Yevgeny Prigozhin）庞大的军事犯罪集团瓜分一空。
item.description: Russian spies are turning disaster into opportunity. Consider the Wagner Group: the Kremlin’s special services quickly divided Yevgeny Prigozhin’s sprawling military-criminal enterprise among themselves econ.st/48kINHH 👇

item.title: 极右翼最青睐的社交媒体平台正在策划卷土重来。您该有多担心？ ⬇️
item.description: The far-right’s favoured social-media platform is plotting a comeback. How concerned should you be? econ.st/49FZ4rZ ⬇️

item.title: 法院应该晚一点开门。纽约市从很酷之前就开始这么做了 ⬇️
item.description: Courts should stay open later. New York City has been doing that since before it was cool econ.st/3SYhRsO ⬇️
